intro: Bulbostylis capillaris subsp. antillana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
